The genus
Wasmannia Wasmannia is endemic to the Neotropics. Its most famous member is
Wasmannia auropunctata W. auropunctata , the “ little fire ant ”. This species does very well in synanthropic habitats throughout the Neotropics and has been introduced to tropical locales throughout the world, where it often becomes a severe pest ant. Other species in the genus are few, and all of them are uncommon relative to their famous relative. Twenty-one available names have accumulated in the taxonomic literature, but there has never been a synthetic review of the genus. Kusnezov (1952
